definition: unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen

sentences.english: He completely monopolized the conversation last night; Mary and I couldn't get a word in edgeways.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚滔滔不绝地讲话，玛丽和我完全插不上嘴。

sentences.english: People drink wine, will be able to.
sentences.chinese: 人喝了好酒，就会变得滔滔善辩。

sentences.english: People gushing on and on about their amazing love life?
sentences.chinese: 有人滔滔不绝地讲述她们那让人惊叹的爱情生活？

sentences.english: The whale only gets harpooned when he spouts.
sentences.chinese: 只有得到的鲸鱼时，他滔滔不绝地镖。

sentences.english: The boat wallowed helplessly in the stormy sea.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船在波浪滔滔的大海中无力地颠簸行驶。

sentences.english: Every words poured out it echoes of your love.
sentences.chinese: 每次滔滔不绝的字都有你爱的回音。

sentences.english: She talks so much that the rest of us never get a look-in .
sentences.chinese: 他讲得滔滔不绝，别人都无法插嘴。

sentences.english: While the master quietly served tea, the professor talked about Zen.
sentences.chinese: 当禅师安静地准备茶水时，学者滔滔不绝地谈着禅。

sentences.english: Charles is such a gasser when he gets going about himself.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯一谈到自己，就劲头十足，滔滔不绝。

sentences.english: First a trickle, then a flood.
sentences.chinese: 先是涓涓细流，接下来是滔滔洪水。

sentences.english: Nothing existed except water, and water existed in two forms.
sentences.chinese: 什么都没有，唯有滔滔水流，以两种形式存在。

sentences.english: The hired orators continued to pour forth their streams of eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 那些雇来的演说家继续滔滔不绝地施展辩才。

sentences.english: Zan hairpin a zoned waves surging, the bitter suffering from hate.
sentences.chinese: 簪钗一划浪滔滔，从此恨海苦煎熬。

sentences.english: Uncle Wang ran on, airing his views about the cases.
sentences.chinese: 王大爷滔滔不绝地谈着，发表对这案件的看法。

sentences.english: He tried to Buy time by doing a lot of talking.
sentences.chinese: 他为了争取时间滔滔不绝地讲个没完。

sentences.english: Because who needs to hear people cursing like Tourette's patients on speed and failing to work together?
sentences.chinese: 有谁愿意听他们滔滔不绝的骂人并导致团队解散吗？

definition: vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
turbid flow/muddy waters/fig. a contemptible person/fig. corrupt or disgraceful social trends
to beat against the shore (of waves)
